Sentencas: The triple phase boundary (TPB), where the gas phase, Ni particles and the yttria-stabilised zirconia (YSZ) surface meet, plays a significant role in the performance of solid oxide fuel cells (SOFC).
Titulo: Density functional theory study of the interaction of H2O, CO2 and Co with the ZrO2 (111), Ni/ZrO2 (111), YSZ (111) and Ni/YSZ (111) surfaces

Sentencas: Indeed, the key reactions take place at the TPB, where molecules such as H2O, CO2 and CO interact and react.
Titulo: Density functional theory study of the interaction of H2O, CO2 and Co with the ZrO2 (111), Ni/ZrO2 (111), YSZ (111) and Ni/YSZ (111) surfaces

Sentencas: We have systematically studied the interaction of H2O, CO2 and CO with the dominant surfaces of four materials that are relevant to SOFC, i.e. ZrO2( 111), Ni/ZrO2(111), YSZ(111) and Ni/YSZ(111) of cubic ZrO2 stabilized with 9% of yttria (Y2O3).
Titulo: Density functional theory study of the interaction of H2O, CO2 and Co with the ZrO2 (111), Ni/ZrO2 (111), YSZ (111) and Ni/YSZ (111) surfaces

Sentencas: The study employed spin polarized density functional theory (DFT), taking into account the long-range dispersion forces.
Titulo: Density functional theory study of the interaction of H2O, CO2 and Co with the ZrO2 (111), Ni/ZrO2 (111), YSZ (111) and Ni/YSZ (111) surfaces

Sentencas: We have investigated up to five initial adsorption sites for the three molecules and have identified the geometries and electronic structures of the most stable adsorption configurations.
Titulo: Density functional theory study of the interaction of H2O, CO2 and Co with the ZrO2 (111), Ni/ZrO2 (111), YSZ (111) and Ni/YSZ (111) surfaces

Sentencas: We have also analysed the vibrational modes of the three molecules in the gas phase and compared them with the adsorbed molecules.
Titulo: Density functional theory study of the interaction of H2O, CO2 and Co with the ZrO2 (111), Ni/ZrO2 (111), YSZ (111) and Ni/YSZ (111) surfaces

Sentencas: A decrease of the wavenumbers of the vibrational modes for the three adsorbed molecules was observed, confirming the influence of the surface on the molecules' intra-molecular bonds.
Titulo: Density functional theory study of the interaction of H2O, CO2 and Co with the ZrO2 (111), Ni/ZrO2 (111), YSZ (111) and Ni/YSZ (111) surfaces

Sentencas: These results are in line with the important role of Ni in this system, in particular for the CO adsorption and activation.
Titulo: Density functional theory study of the interaction of H2O, CO2 and Co with the ZrO2 (111), Ni/ZrO2 (111), YSZ (111) and Ni/YSZ (111) surfaces
